LAGU.text: The belly of an adult breeding Franklin's Gull is sometimes tinged with pink. That never happens with Laughing Gulls.
The white crescents above and below the eye are noticeably thicker than on a Laughing Gull.

BOGU.text: The white crescents above and below the eye are noticeably thicker than on a Bonaparte's Gull.

LAGU.text: The Franklin's Gull has a red bill that is smaller and straighter than the Laughing Gull's bill.

BOGU.text: The Franklin's Gull has a deep reddish bill. The Bonaparte's Gull bill is black and quite thin.

general.text: GENERIC Bill text for Franklin's Gull.

LAGU.text: Franklin's Gulls have black wing tips separated from the grey inner wing by extensive white. Laughing Gulls don't have white near the wingtips. When standing, no white visible on the tail.

BOGU.text: Franklin's Gulls have white underwings, with black spots on the tips.  Upperside gray with white band on back of wing, and next to black tips. Bonaparte's Gulls have a distinctive thin white triangle on upper-wings' outer primaries

LAGU.text: Franklin gulls are usually silent, except in a colony. Laughing Gulls are quite (sometimes extremely) vocal.
